summary.p: The Kirakacintāmaṇi, also known as Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ, a work on astrology, by Vīmēcurar.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (September 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: the front cover. BnF shelfmark sticker on back cover, verso.
2 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Unblackened blessings on f[1]r. f[1]v, f[2]rv blank. 330 x 35 mm.
126 folios = Kirakacintāmaṇi: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation 1-126. 330 x 35 mm.
2 folios = back guard leaves. Blank recto verso. 330 x 35 mm.

supportDesc.condition: Excellent state of preservation, but some folios somehow damaged by boreholes.

binding.p: Original brown wood covers. 330 x 35 mm.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1828 by Vinson (1868) and to 1828 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably Ducler's provenance). By Ducler's scribe, working around 1830. Probably not before 1828 (date of the earliest internally dated Ducler's manuscript). Not later than its first mention (Burnouf 1832).

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 88.

listBibl.bibl: Kirakacintāmaṇi. 1933. Vīmēcura Uḷḷamuṭaiyāṉ. Ceṉṉai: Pūmakaḷvilāca Accukkūṭam.

Burnouf, Eugène. 1832. Rapport fait au Conseil, dans la séance du 2 juillet 1832, sur les collections de manuscrits et de dessins rapportées de l’Inde par M. Ducler, administrateur de Carical, membre de la Société asiatique. Journal asiatique 10: 84-91. — See p. 90, n0. 32.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 18, n0. 92.
Velanguani Arokium [Vēḷāṅkaṇṇi Ārōkkiyam]. 1845. Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls de la Bibliothèque royale. BnF NAF 5443. — See p. 9, no. 2.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 25, no. 92.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
